details.portfolioPiece: Sound Redesign Project for Assassin's Creed
details.description:
A sound redesign of the Assassin’s Creed Codename Hexe trailer, focused on creating an immersive, atmospheric soundscape that supports the trailer’s dark, eerie aesthetic. The goal was to tell a story through sound, using audio to evoke emotion, build tension, and enhance the narrative.

Original audio elements were crafted from scratch through a blend of foley recording with a personal microphone setup and sound synthesis using various VST plugins. Novum and IZotope played a key role in shaping ambient textures and haunting atmospheres. The main challenge was achieving rich, layered sounds under tight time constraints, solved through iterative design and targeted feedback.

Insania is a point-and-click psychological horror game that explores the fragile boundary between reality and delusion. The story follows Dr. James Cawley, a man confronting his crumbling sanity as he searches for a way home, only to uncover dark truths about his past, including the tragic loss of his daughter, Lily, and the blurred reality shaped by his own mind.

Developed with a team of six, the game features a sanity mechanic where player interactions trigger auditory and visual hallucinations, intensifying the psychological tension. Original audio was crafted using Ableton Live 11 and Adobe Audition, focusing on layered sounds—from distorted environmental effects to disorienting whispers.

Key contributions include designing immersive sound effects, shaping the core game mechanics, and co-creating the narrative structure. The result is a compelling, story-driven experience that pulls players deep into the fractured reality of the protagonist’s mind.

IceAge is a 2.5D platformer blending 2D characters with a 3D environment, created for The Monster Project. The game follows IceAge, a frost fairy on a quest to reclaim stolen ice crystals and save her transformed ice sparks from a vengeful fire demon. Developed with a team of six, the project involved collaboration with Concordia Enschede and International School Twente, with a final showcase presented to the children who inspired the game’s monsters. My key roles included leading the team through task management, planning, and execution, as well as UI design, sound effects, and gameplay mechanics. I also focused on game testing and iterative design to refine puzzle-solving, companion-based gameplay, and dynamic environments.

Dad’s Day Out is a serious game that explores the challenges and nuances of modern parenting. The player steps into the role of a father navigating daily life, balancing work responsibilities with the emotional and developmental needs of his child. The game’s core objective is to reflect on parenting styles, with outcomes influenced by the player's in-game decisions and time management.

Developed with a team of six, the game features an isometric 3D environment where players move through the house, completing various tasks. Each household chore is designed as a unique 2D mini-game, ranging from watering plants to drawing with the child, emphasizing the contrast between routine responsibilities and quality bonding moments. The game’s economy system analyzes player behavior to determine their parenting style, offering insightful feedback based on choices made.

Key contributions include sound design, gameplay mechanics, and shaping the overall game experience to foster reflection on parent-child dynamics.
